description: Numbers n such that d(n) (number of divisors) divides phi(n) (Euler function) divides sigma(n) (sum of divisors).
comments: Numbers n such that sigma_0(n) divides phi(n) divides sigma_1(n).
references: D. Wells, Curious and interesting numbers, Penguin Books, p. 130
links: Donovan Johnson, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: 210 has 16 divisors, which divides phi(210)=48, which in turn divides sigma(210)=576, so 210 is a member of the sequence.
prog: (PARI) for(n=1, 1e3, if(sigma(n)%eulerphi(n)==0, if(sigma(n)%numdiv(n)==0, if(eulerphi(n)%numdiv(n)==0, print1(n, ", "))))) \\ _Felix Fr√∂hlich_, Aug 08 2014
author: _David W. Wilson_
